wrapScienceJ.wrapImaJ.test

Class TestConnectedComponents

  • java.lang.Object
    • wrapScienceJ.wrapImaJ.test.TestConnectedComponents

  • public class TestConnectedComponents
extends java.lang.Object
    Allows to test Connected Components labeling for images (typically binary images or image's background).
    Author:
    Remy Malgouyres
    See Also:
    wrapScienceJ.wrapImaJ.connectivity, wrapScienceJ.wrapImaJ.connectivity, wrapScienceJ.wrapImaJ.connectivity.filtering

    • Method Detail

      • testComponentsLabeling

        public static void testComponentsLabeling(java.lang.String inputImageFile,
                                          LabelingPolicy labelingPolicy,
                                          double componentVolumeThreshold)
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Test for labeling connected components of a binarized image. Only connected components with no voxel on the image's boundary are kept in the filtering process. Connected components with a volume below some threshold are also removed. a constant random gray level is set on each connected component.
        Parameters:
        inputImageFile - the input image file on disk
        labelingPolicy - Can be 3D components labeling, or slice by slice against a given axis.
        componentVolumeThreshold - Minimal volume for filtering (taking into account the calibration) for the components. 0 if no minimal volume is required
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - In case of overflow of the number of connected components.
        java.io.IOException - In case of file read error

      • testGetLabelsAsImage

        public static void testGetLabelsAsImage(java.lang.String inputImageFile,
                                        LabelingPolicy labelingPolicy,
                                        double componentVolumeThreshold)
                                 throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                                        java.io.IOException
        Test for labeling connected components of a binarized image. Only connected components with no voxel on the image's boundary are kept in the filtering process. Connected components with a volume below some threshold are also removed. a constant random gray level is set on each connected component.
        Parameters:
        inputImageFile - the input image file on disk
        labelingPolicy - Can be 3D components labeling, or slice by slice against a given axis.
        componentVolumeThreshold - Minimal volume for filtering (taking into account the calibration) for the components. 0 if no minimal volume is required
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - In case of overflow of the number of connected components.
        java.io.IOException - In case of file read error

      • testComponentsPredicateFiltering

        public static void testComponentsPredicateFiltering(java.lang.String inputImageFile,
                                                    boolean keepPredicate,
                                                    boolean complementPredicate)
                                             throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                                                    java.io.IOException
        Test for filtering of connected components based on a thick surface. Only connected components with at least one voxel satisfying a predicate are kept through this filtering. In this example, the predicate is true if the voxel lies in a thick plane
        Parameters:
        inputImageFile - the input image file on disk
        keepPredicate - true if we should keep the components with a voxel satisfying removalPredicate, and false if we should remove the components with a voxel satisfying removalPredicate
        complementPredicate - true if we should consider the complement of the predicate
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - In case of overflow of the number of connected components.
        java.io.IOException - In case of file read error

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main function of the package's tests.
        Parameters:
        args -
